abstract: The family that controls Dow Jones is preparing to submit a new set of proposals to News Corporation on how to protect The Wall Street Journal’s editorial independence in a potential sale, The Journal reported. Separately, The Times of London, which is owned by News Corporation, reported Tuesday that General Electric is still considering an offer for Dow Jones after talks of a joint bid with Microsoft broke down.
lead_paragraph: The family that controls Dow Jones is preparing to submit a new set of proposals to News Corporation on how to protect The Wall Street Journal’s editorial independence in a potential sale, The Journal reported. Separately, The Times of London, which is owned by News Corporation, reported Tuesday that General Electric is still considering an offer for Dow Jones after talks of a joint bid with Microsoft broke down.

headline.main: Bancrofts Said to Prepare New Proposal for Murdoch
